com.ibm.team.interop.common

Interface IPropertyMapping


  • public interface IPropertyMapping
    Class to represent the identification of a property of an external object that is being replicated in a Jazz repository, and possibly synchronized with a property of a Jazz item. The class identifies the name of the external property, the name of the Jazz item property that corresponds with it (if any), and whether synchronization is incoming (Jazz property set from external property), outgoing (external property set from Jazz property), or both.

    Note that the type of the external object and the type of any Jazz item being synchronized with it are identified by the synchronization rule that contains this mapping object.

    The transformation between external property values and Jazz property values are defined by the values returned by #getTransformExtensionName() and getValueMappings(). If #getTransformExtensionName() returns a non-null value, then it identifies an extension that is invoked to compute a value. If getValueMappings() returns a non-null value, then the mapping is between enumerated values. Otherwise, values are simply copied verbatim.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    ISyncRule, IValueMapping

      • getExternalPropertyName

        java.lang.String getExternalPropertyName()
        Get the name of the external property being replicated and/or synchronized.
        Returns:
        the external property name; may be null or the empty string if the property is not marked for outgoing synchronization

      • setExternalPropertyName

        void setExternalPropertyName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the external property name for this mapping.
        Parameters:
        name - the external property name; may be null

      • getItemPropertyName

        java.lang.String getItemPropertyName()
        Get the name of the Jazz item property being synchronized with the external item.
        Returns:
        the Jazz item property name being synchronized; may be null or the empty string if the property is not marked for incoming synchronization

      • setItemPropertyName

        void setItemPropertyName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of the Jazz item property being synchronized with the external property.
        Parameters:
        name - the Jazz item property name; may be null

      • isIncoming

        boolean isIncoming()
        Determine whether incoming synchronization applies (the Jazz property should be set from the external property). Only defined if getItemPropertyName() returns a non-null value.
        Returns:
        true if incoming synchronization, false if not

      • setIncoming

        void setIncoming(boolean mode)
        Set whether incoming synchronization applies.
        Parameters:
        mode - true to enable incoming synchronization, false to disable it

      • isOutgoing

        boolean isOutgoing()
        Determine whether outgoing synchronization applies (the external property should be set from the Jazz property). Only defined if getItemPropertyName() returns a non-null value.
        Returns:
        true if outgoing synchronization, false if not

      • setOutgoing

        void setOutgoing(boolean mode)
        Set whether outgoing synchronization applies.
        Parameters:
        mode - true to enable outgoing synchronization, false to disable it

      • isItemIdentifier

        boolean isItemIdentifier()
        Determine whether this property value can be used as an identifier for finding existing Jazz items. At most one property in a list of property mappings will be marked as an item identifier.
        Returns:
        true if this property value can be used to find existing Jazz items; false if not
        Since:
        0.6

      • setItemIdentifier

        void setItemIdentifier(boolean value)
        Set whether the value of this property can be used as an identifier for finding existing Jazz items. At most one property in a list of property mappings may be marked as an item identifier.
        Parameters:
        value - true if this property value can be used to find existing Jazz items; false if not
        Since:
        0.6

      • isExternalIdentifier

        boolean isExternalIdentifier()
        Determine whether this property value can be used as an identifier for finding existing external objects. At most one property in a list of property mappings will be marked as an external identifier.
        Returns:
        true if this property value can be used to find existing external objects; false if not
        Since:
        0.6

      • setExternalIdentifier

        void setExternalIdentifier(boolean value)
        Set whether the value of this property can be used as an identifier for finding existing external objects. At most one property in a list of property mappings may be marked as an external identifier.
        Parameters:
        value - true if this property value can be used to find existing external objects; false if not
        Since:
        0.6

      • isExternalModifier

        boolean isExternalModifier()
        Determine whether this external property value can be used to determine the identity of the user that modified the external object.
        Returns:
        true if the external value of this property is the identifier of the user that modified the external object; false if not
        Since:
        0.6

      • setExternalModifier

        void setExternalModifier(boolean value)
        Set whether the external value of this property can be used to determine the identity of the user that modified the external object.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the external value of this property can be used to identify the user that modified the external object; false if not

      • getRequiredItemPropertiesList

        java.util.List getRequiredItemPropertiesList()
        Get any item properties which must be computed before the item property represented by this mapping is. Each list element is a String.

        This list is a copy; to modify the required item properties, use setRequiredItemPropertiesList(List)

        Returns:
        a list of required item property names needed to compute this mapping's property; may be empty; never null
        Since:
        0.6

      • setRequiredItemPropertiesList

        void setRequiredItemPropertiesList(java.util.List properties)
        Set the item properties which must be computed before the item property represented by this mapping. If the list is null or empty, the required properties are cleared. Otherwise, each list element must be a String.
        Parameters:
        properties - the list of item properties required by this mapping's item property; may be empty or null to clear the list
        Since:
        0.6

      • getRequiredExternalPropertiesList

        java.util.List getRequiredExternalPropertiesList()
        Get any external properties which must be computed before the external property represented by this mapping is. Each list element is a String.

        This list is a copy; to modify the required item properties, use setRequiredExternalPropertiesList(List)

        Returns:
        a list of required external property names needed to compute this mapping's property; may be empty; never null
        Since:
        0.6

      • setRequiredExternalPropertiesList

        void setRequiredExternalPropertiesList(java.util.List properties)
        Set the external properties which must be computed before the external property represented by this mapping. If the list is null or empty, the required properties are cleared. Otherwise, each list element must be a String.
        Parameters:
        properties - the list of external properties required by this mapping's external property; may be empty or null to clear the list
        Since:
        0.6

      • getTransformExtension

        java.lang.String getTransformExtension()
        Get the name of any value transformation extension. If this method returns a non-null, non-empty value, it is assumed to be the name of an extension which can be invoked to compute a property value. If this method returns a null or empty value, then some other transformation type will be used.
        Returns:
        the name of a property transformation extension, or null or the empty string if the value is defined by some other transformation

      • setTransformExtension

        void setTransformExtension(java.lang.String value)
        Set the name of a transformation extension. See getTransformExtension() for the details of this type of transformation.
        Parameters:
        value - the transformation extension name, or null or the empty string to disable any transformation extension
        See Also:
        getTransformExtension()

      • getValueMappings

        java.util.List getValueMappings()
        Get any enumerated value mappings defined for the transformation between external and Jazz property values. If this method returns a non-empty list, the result is a list of IValueMapping objects that define the mapping between the values. If this method returns a null value or empty list, then some other transformation type will be used.

        To modify the value mappings for this transformation, call this method to get the list, then add or remove entries from it.

        Returns:
        a list of IValueMapping objects; may be empty; never null

      • getItemValueMapping

        IValueMapping getItemValueMapping(java.lang.String itemValue)
        Get the mapping for a particular item value, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        itemValue - the external value
        Returns:
        the mapping for the item value, or null if none was found
        Since:
        0.7

      • getExternalValueMapping

        IValueMapping getExternalValueMapping(java.lang.String externalValue)
        Get the mapping for a particular external value, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        externalValue - the external value
        Returns:
        the mapping for the external value, or null if none was found
        Since:
        0.7

      • getReferenceSyncRule

        java.lang.String getReferenceSyncRule()
        Get the name of a sync rule to use for synchronizing referenced objects. If this value is set, it means that the values of the properties identified by this mapping are references to other objects. For Jazz items, the property value (if non-null) in its string form must be zero or more item UUIDs, separated by a space character (if more than one). For external objects, the property value (if non-null) must be zero or more URI strings, separated by a space character (if more than one). Furthermore, since property values are compared for equality as strings, the order of multiple of the UUIDs or URIs in the string encoding must always be the same. Manager classes are encouraged to be based on com.ibm.team.interop.service.AbstractInteropItemManager or com.ibm.team.interop.service.AbstractInteropExternalManager in order to use the encoding and decoding routines that meet these formatting requirements.
        Returns:
        the name of the sync rule to use for synchronizing objects referenced by this property value, or null or the empty string if some other transformation is being used

      • setReferenceSyncRule

        void setReferenceSyncRule(java.lang.String syncRuleName)
        Set the name of the sync rule to use for synchronizing objects referenced by the value of the property this mapping is for. See getReferenceSyncRule() for the details of this type of transformation.
        Parameters:
        syncRuleName - the name of the sync rule to use for referenced objects, or null or the empty string to use some other transformation for this property
